definition: protective coloration/camouflage
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
to protect
color/CL:種|种[zhong3]/look/appearance/sex
color/dice

sentences.english: Some of them are protective colouring that is designed to make it easier to survive in a crowded, judgemental and often intolerant world.
sentences.chinese: 有些是爲了更好地在嘈雜殘酷的世界中生存的保護色。

sentences.english: Acamouflaged shape moving through the sun-dappled shadows.
sentences.chinese: 一個保護色的身形在陽光斑駁的陰影中移動。

sentences.english: For chameleons this is a defense strategy, is it the same for us?
sentences.chinese: 對於變色龍來說，這叫做保護色，對我們也是這樣嗎？

sentences.english: Some insects have a natural camouflage which hide them from the attack of their enemy.
sentences.chinese: 有些昆蟲有一種天然的保護色可以防止敵人的襲擊。

sentences.english: The protective color of some plants and animals changes with their surroundings.
sentences.chinese: 一些動植物的保護色會隨環境的變化而變化。

sentences.english: For others, it is a form of camouflage .
sentences.chinese: 對另一些生物而言，光亮則相當於保護色。

sentences.english: Their white fur serves as protective coloring in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 它們白色的皮毛，在雪中起保護色的作用。

sentences.english: Some insects often escape observation because of protective coloring.
sentences.chinese: 有些昆蟲因有保護色而往往不被察覺。

definition: female gossip/busybody
lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance/fig. to find fault in minor details/nitpicking/overcritical
to behave unscrupulously
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
improvisation
to withdraw/to hole up
to return something to its rightful owner
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
willingly and gladly (idiom)
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to whisper to one another's ear
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
